qas.question: What year did BSkyB and Virgin Media have a dispute over the carriage of Sky Channels on cable TV?
What channels were removed from the network in March of 2007?
What did Virgin Media claim BSkyB did that resulted Virgin not carrying the channels anymore?

answers.text: that BSkyB had substantially increased the asking price for the channels

qas.question: What additional srevice did BSkyB offer besides HD channels that they claimed offered "substantially more value"?

answers.text: HD channels and Video On Demand

qas.question: What additional srevice did BSkyB offer besides Video on Demand that they claimed offered "substantially more value"?
What year did BSkyB and Virgin Media have an agreement over the carriage of Sky Channels on cable TV?
What channels were always available on the network?
What additional service did BSkyB offer besides HD channels that they claimed offered no value?

plausible_answers.text: BSkyB had substantially increased the asking price for the channels

qas.question: What claim did BSkyB agree with?
When were basic channels first introduced by BSkyB?

context: In <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><b5_0>2007<b5_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/>, BSkyB and Virgin Media became involved in a dispute over the carriage of Sky channels on cable TV. The failure to renew the existing carriage agreements negotiated with NTL and Telewest resulted in Virgin Media removing <a1_1><a1_2>the <a1_0><b6_0>basic channels<b6_0/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> from the network on <b9_0>1 March 2007<b9_0/>.
